Certainly! Here are a few lens options that are commonly used for astrophotography:

1. Wide-angle lenses: Wide-angle lenses are great for capturing expansive views of the night sky, such as the Milky Way. They have a shorter focal length and can capture more of the sky in a single shot. Popular options include the Canon EF 16-35mm f/2.8L and the Nikon AF-S Nikkor 14-24mm f/2.8G ED. 2. Fast lenses: Lenses with a wider maximum aperture, such as f/1.4 or f/1.8, are known as "fast" lenses. They can capture more light in a shorter amount of time, making them great for capturing low-light scenes like the night sky. Popular options include the Canon EF 50mm f/1.4 USM and the Nikon AF-S Nikkor 50mm f/1.8G. 3. Zoom lenses: Zoom lenses can offer more versatility in capturing different types of objects in the night sky. Options like the Tamron 70-200mm f/2.8 and the Sigma 150-600mm f/5-6.3 DG OS HSM are popular among astrophotographers. Remember that the best lens for astrophotography ultimately depends on your specific needs and preferences. Factors like the level of light pollution in your area and the types of objects you want to capture should also be considered. Good luck with your astrophotography endeavors!
